JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Mihai Poalelungi;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . The first applicant is the son of the second applicant . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an application with the ORG ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) against GPE under LAW of the LAW . They alleged that ORG , CARDINAL § DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and LAW CARDINAL to the Convention had been violated as a result of the non - enforcement of a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE obliging the local water supply company to conclude a contract for water supply with the second applicant , distinctive than the one concluded with the association of all landlords living in the same building .

CARDINAL . NORP In a judgment of DATE the ORG analysed all the complaints raised by the applicants only under LAW and held that there had been a violation of this article due to the non - enforcement of the final judgment in the ORG favour . As to the application of Article CARDINAL , the ORG ordered ORG to pay the applicants jointly QUANTITY in respect of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages .
On DATE ORG paid the damages as ordered by the ORG .

At their FAC meeting held on DATE , the Deputies decided to postpone the examination of this case at their next meeting in view of the fact that bilateral contacts were under way in order to assess new information received from the Government on the issue of the continuing non - enforcement of the domestic court judgment of CARDINAL DATE . The adoption of a resolution is still pending in this case .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . Following the adoption of the ORG ’s judgment of DATE , the water supply company sent several letters to the applicants expressing its willingness to conclude a contract with them . Hence , by letters sent on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , the company informed the applicants that in order to conclude a distinctive water supply contract a new branching was necessary with the purpose to separate the supply to their apartment from the common supply of the entire building . On CARDINAL occasions , on DATE and DATE , representatives of the water supply company came to the applicants’ building in order to perform the necessary works but did not find them at home .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE addressed to the water supply company the applicants expressed their disagreement for the construction of a separate branching invoking both the domestic judgment as well as the ORG ’s judgment which made no express order in this respect .
CARDINAL . According to the parties’ submissions , the judgment of CARDINAL DATE remained non - enforced to date .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law concerning the execution of final judgments , namely excerpts of LAW and Law no . PERSON on the powers and functions of bailiffs , is summed up in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of GPE v. GPE ( ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL , DATE ) .
